subject: Nutrition
title: Pre-Workout Nutrition
description: Learn Pre-Workout Nutrition in one minute.

hook.text: Wrong food before exercise causes nausea. No food causes fatigue. Getting it right matters.

buildup.text: A pre-workout meal should be high in carbs, moderate in protein, and low in fatâ€”eaten 2 to 4 hours before.

discovery.text: Carbs top off glycogen and maintain blood sugar. Protein prevents muscle breakdown during exercise.

twist.text: Fasted training doesn't burn more fat long-term. Total daily intake matters more than pre-workout timing.

climax.text: The ideal pre-workout meal is boringâ€”oatmeal, banana, toast. Simple food that digests fast and sits well.

punchline.text: The best pre-workout food is whatever doesn't fight back.

quiz.question: When should a pre-workout meal be eaten?
